Package org.example.unogame.model.machine

Class ThreadSingUNOMachine

java.lang.Object
org.example.unogame.model.machine.ThreadSingUNOMachine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Runnable
public class ThreadSingUNOMachine extends Object implements Runnable, Serializable
Background worker that simulates the machine's behavior for calling "UNO".

This runnable periodically checks the number of cards each player has and, based on simple conditions, triggers "UNO" calls through the GameUnoController. It also coordinates flags that affect whether the human can call "UNO" or whether the machine can call "UNO" against the human.

Threading

  • This class is intended to run on a dedicated thread (e.g., via Thread).
  • It uses a simple loop with a randomized sleep to simulate reaction time.
  • External code can stop the loop by calling setRunning(boolean).
  • UI updates are delegated to the controller; those should be performed on the JavaFX thread.
See Also:

      public ThreadSingUNOMachine(ArrayList<Card> cardsPlayer, ArrayList<Card> machineCardsPlayer, GameUnoController gameUnoController, ThreadPlayMachine threadPlayMachine) throws GameException.ThreadInitializationException
      Creates a new UNO-calling worker.
      Parameters:
      cardsPlayer - reference to the human player's cards
      machineCardsPlayer - reference to the machine player's cards
      gameUnoController - controller used for UI updates and shared flags
      threadPlayMachine - the machine's play thread (required reference)
      Throws:
      GameException.ThreadInitializationException - if any argument is null

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(GameUnoController gameUnoController, ThreadPlayMachine threadPlayMachine) throws GameException.ThreadInitializationException
      Throws:
      GameException.ThreadInitializationException

    • run

      public void run()
      Main loop: sleeps for a random short interval, checks if it should continue running, then evaluates whether any player has exactly one card to trigger corresponding "UNO" logic.

      If the owning controller disables the UNO thread (see GameUnoController.isRunningOneThread()), this loop stops.

      Interrupted sleeps are wrapped into a GameException.ThreadInterruptedException and propagated as a RuntimeException to terminate the thread.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • setMachineCanSayOne

      public void setMachineCanSayOne(boolean machineCanSayOne)
      Enables or disables the machine's ability to call UNO for itself.
      Parameters:
      machineCanSayOne - true to allow; false to block

    • setMachineCanSayOneToPlayer

      public void setMachineCanSayOneToPlayer(boolean machineCanSayOneToPlayer)
      Enables or disables the machine's ability to call UNO against the human player.
      Parameters:
      machineCanSayOneToPlayer - true to allow; false to block

    • setRunning

      public void setRunning(boolean running)
      Starts or stops the worker loop. When stopping, notifies any thread waiting on this monitor to avoid potential deadlocks.
      Parameters:
      running - true to keep running; false to stop
